business.headline: Hexaware Technologies IPO: Check allotment status, listing date and GMPInvestors who applied for the IPO can check their allotment status online through the registrar, KFin Technologies, or via the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website.
India-Israel free trade deal on the cards: What it means for both nationsA group of over 100 Israeli companies visited India, and held more than 600 business meetings with Indian business leaders.

India slashes import duty on bourbon whisky to 100% after Trump's criticismThe reduction in customs duty on bourbon whisky was notified on February 13 just ahead of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's talks with US President Donald Trump.
What is digital lending? 5 key benefits you should know Digital lending platforms make use of advanced technology, thereby making the loan process faster, simpler and more efficient.

New Income Tax bill: Has it really been simplified for taxpayers?The proposed income tax bill seeks to simplify and revamp the Income Tax Act of 1961, which has often been criticised for its complexity, making it challenging for ordinary taxpayers to navigate.
New UPI transaction rule: All you need to know about auto chargeback processThe changes are primarily regarding auto acceptance and rejection of chargebacks, thereby making the system more efficient.
Sensex, Nifty end lower as FIIs continue to exit Dalal StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 199.76 points to end at 75,939.21, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 102.15 points to close at 22,929.25.

Explained: Why Vodafone Idea share price tumbled nearly 6%VI shares were down 5.09% to Rs 8.22 at around 3:15 pm. Earlier during the trading session, shares of the telecom operator fell as much as 6%.

Ambani family richest in Asia. Check which Indian families made the top 20The Ambani family tops Bloomberg's list of Asia's 20 richest families. The family's flagship company, Reliance Industries, is presently headed by Mukesh Ambani, son of late industrialist Dhirubhai Ambani.

RBI curbs on New India Co-operative Bank: How does it impact customers?New India Co-operative Bank has been struggling with financial losses in recent years. According to its annual report, the bank recorded a loss of Rs 22.78 crore in the financial year ending March 2024, following a loss of Rs 30.75 crore in the previous year.

New India Co-operative Bank's financial operations halted after notice from RBIThe Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has restricted Mumbai-based New India Co-operative Bank from issuing loans, accepting deposits, or permitting withdrawals for six months. The move comes amid concerns over the bank's financial health and liquidity.

Not Trump's tariffs, but this is what's making stock market investors anxiousThe stock market jitters have occurred despite government measures, including tax relief and the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) decision to reduce the repo rate by 25 basis points.

entertainment.headline: South Korean actor Kim Sae-ron, 24, found deadSouth Korean actor Kim Sae-ron, known for her roles in Bloodhounds and The Man from Nowhere, was found dead at her home in Seoul. She was 24. Authorities are investigating the circumstances of her death, with no signs of foul play reported yet.

The White Lotus S3 review: Predictable? Yes. Addictive? Also, yesReleased-Mon Feb 17, 2025The White Lotus Season 3 review: The White Lotus returns with a new season set in Thailand, offering a fresh cultural backdrop while retaining its biting satire on the ultra-rich. The series continues to entertain with its dark humour and ensemble cast, though its formula is starting to feel familiar. Read our full review.

Kanye West says he fought 5 hours for Grammy tickets amid guest list confusionRapper Kanye West, in a post on X, revealed that he fought for five hours to secure Grammy tickets amid guest list chaos. This comes amid claims that Kanye arrived at the event uninvited.

Comedian Anubhav Bassi's Lucknow show cancelled after warning over foul languageThe shows of comedian Anubhav Singh Bassi in Lucknow were cancelled due to concerns over inappropriate content, following a complaint by the UP Women's Commission vice-chairperson. Authorities cited potential law and order issues as reasons for the cancellation.

Watch: Chum Darang blushes as Karan Veer confesses love on Valentine's DayKaran Veer Mehra confessed his love for Chum Darang on Valentine's Day. Chum shared a post from their romantic outing on social media.
Watch: Ed Sheeran pauses Delhi concert as fan faints, wears Team India jerseyEd Sheeran wrapped up his India tour in Gurugram on February 15. He paused his concert briefly to help a fan who fainted.

Shalin Bhanot reacts to India's Got Latent Row, advocates self-disciplineTV actor Shalin Bhanot has reacted to the controversy surrounding YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia's comment on India's Got Latent during the FDCI's India Men's Weekend in Jaipur. He emphasised self-discipline and responsibility.

Today is a victory: Jay-Z reacts after rape lawsuit against him droppedIn a significant legal victory, rapper Jay-Z has seen a sexual assault lawsuit against him dismissed. The rapper and entrepreneur expressed relief and satisfaction over the court's decision.

No one can save him: Mahabharat actor threatens Ranveer Allahbadia Actor Saurav Gurjar openly threatened Ranveer Allahbadia over his recent remarks on India's Got Latent. In a video message, the actor requested the government to take strict action against the podcaster.

Drake releases new album amid feud with Kendrick Lamar, fails to impress fansDrake appears to have ended his feud with Kendrick Lamar in his latest album, but fans remain unimpressed. Released on Valentine's Day, the album in collaboration with PartyNextDoor marks his first new work since the Super Bowl halftime show.

Bharti Singh supports Samay Raina amid India's Got Latent controversyComedian Bharti Singh supported Samay Raina amid the India's Got Latent controversy. The comedian praised Samay and said that he is very sweet, and anyone can become his fan once they get to meet him.

Women's panel summons Elvish Yadav over remarks against Chum Darang on Feb 17YouTuber Elvish Yadav has been summoned by a women's panel following his racist remarks against Chum Darang. Yadav criticised her name and nationality, sparking courage among northeastern citizens.

general news.headline: 4.0 magnitude quake jolts Delhi-NCR, strong tremors felt across regionA 4.0 magnitude earthquake hit Delhi-NCR early on Monday with its epicentre in the national capital. The tremors lasted for a few seconds and caused panic among residents.

Stay calm, be alert for possible aftershocks: PM after quake rocks Delhi-NCRPrime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday urged the residents of Delhi-NCR region to stay calm and follow safety protocols, barely two hours after a 4.0 magnitude earthquake hit the national capital.

Man trying to exit station due to overcrowding lost 7-year-old in Delhi stampedeSeven-year-old Riya was among the 18 people killed in the stampede at New Delhi Railway Station on Saturday. She was trying to leave the station with her parents after they decided to call off their journey due to the rush.

Unusual sound, scariest thing ever experienced: Delhi residents after quake scareA strong earthquake measuring 4.0 on the Richter scale jolted Delhi and its adjoining National Capital Region at around 5.35 am on Monday. As per the National Center for Seismology, the epicentre was near Durgabai Deshmukh College of Special Education in Dhaula Kuan.

Delhi earthquake: What made the rumbling sounds beneath your feetThe earthquake's epicentre was located in Delhi, at a shallow depth of only 5 km. This shallow origin likely intensified the tremors felt across the region.

Netanyahu's 'open gates of hell' warning to Hamas over release of hostagesBenjamin Netanyahu has said that Israel and the United States have a "common strategy" regarding Gaza and reaffirmed his government's commitment to eliminating Hamas' military and political presence.

NDA ally opposes Maharashtra's move for 'love jihad' law: All are equal for PMUnion Minister Ramdas Athawale opposed Maharashtra's plan to draft a 'love jihad' law. The state recently issued a Government Resolution (GR), forming a DGP-led committee to study similar laws, suggest legal measures, and recommend legislation.

Himanta Sarma on Gaurav Gogoi's wife's 'Pak link': He may have been trappedAssam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma on Sunday suggested that Congress MP Gaurav Gogoi may have been "trapped or blackmailed" in a larger "anti-India" conspiracy involving his British wife, Elizabeth Colburn.

Free Samay Raina: Badshah's shout-out at his concert amid India's Got Latent rowRapper Badshah recently performed at Vadodara's Parul University. He shouted 'Free Samay Raina' as the audience cheered for him.

Beyond Budget 2025: Not cities, create 50 circuits of developed tourismThe goal, industry experts say, should be to offer tourist packages because travellers, unlike local day-trippers, don't visit just one location

RCB didn't want to pressurise Virat Kohli by making him captain: ManjrekarIPL 2025: Sanjay Manjrekar said that Virat Kohli would be at his very best after RCB didn't put pressure on him with the responsibility of captaincy for the upcoming edition of the tournament.

BAFTA Awards 2025: All We Imagine As Light loses out to Emilia PerezThe Spanish musical Emilia Perez clinched the Best Film Not in the English Language award at the 78th BAFTAs, surpassing the Indian film, All We Imagine As Light.
Video: Man flung off bike after head-on collision with car in LucknowA speeding bike crashed into a car in Lucknow on February 12, throwing the rider into the air before he hit the ground.

The state of the mob and the failure of the stateAt the New Delhi railway station on Saturday night, a "sea of humanity" travelling for a Kumbh dip was waiting for the train to Prayagraj. A platform-change announcement triggered a tsunami in that sea. Faith, fate, and a whole lot of frantic feet. India has a mob problem.

Mohan Bhagwat calls for Hindu unity, says it is India's 'responsible society'RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Sunday stressed Hindu unity, calling it the nation's "responsible" community and an embodiment of diversity. Speaking at an RSS event in Bardhaman, he said, "Hindu society is the country's responsible society."

BAFTA Awards 2025: Adrien Brody, Mikey Madison bag top honours, full list hereThe prestigious BAFTA Awards 2025 took place at the Royal Albert Hall in London on February 16 (February 17 in India). While Adrien Brody won Best Actor, Mikey Madison is the Best Actress.

Champions Trophy Classics: When tail wagged to help West Indies script historyThe final of the ICC Champions Trophy 2004 played between the West Indies and England at the Oval is still counted amongst the greatest final of an ICC event, thanks to a game-changing batting heroics of Ian Bradshaw and Courtney Browne. Relive the classic game in our special feature ahead of the upcoming edition of the tournament.

US flight carrying third batch of 112 Indian deportees lands in AmritsarA US Air Force C-17 Globemaster landed in Amritsar, carrying 112 Indians deported from the US for illegal residency. This marks the third such arrival in 10 days amid US immigration crackdowns.

Delhi Chief Minister oath likely on February 18: SourcesThe BJP is set to finalise its Chief Minister soon, with several contenders, including Parvesh Verma, Vijender Gupta, and potential women candidates, under consideration.

Pakistani man dances to Nimbooda Nimbooda in viral video. Internet loves his graceA video of a Pakistani man dancing effortlessly to Aishwarya Rai Bachchan's hit song 'Nimbooda Nimbooda' has gone viral on social media.

Women, children not restrained on 2nd US flight that landed in Amritsar: SourcesA plane carrying 116 Indian deportees from the US landed in Amritsar. This is the second such deportation under US immigration policies. The flight followed a meeting between Prime Minister Modi and President Trump in Washington.

IPL schedule: KKR vs RCB in opener on March 22, final in Kolkata on May 25IPL 2025: The BCCI announced the full schedule for the new season. KKR will take on RCB in the opening match on March 22 while the final will be in Kolkata on May 25. A total of 13 venues to host 74 matches in the 2025 season.

16,000 workers create 26 hectares of additional land in 80 days for Maha KumbhAhead of the Maha Kumbh, 16,000 workers laboured for 80 days to create 26 hectares of additional land at Sangam Ghat. The Ganga, previously flowing in three streams, struggled to form a proper confluence due to sand islands.

Pushpa actor Daali Dhananjaya marries Dhanyatha Gauraklar, first pics outKannada actor Daali Dhananjaya got married to Dr Dhanyatha Gauraklar in a close-knit ceremony, attended by friends and family. The first pictures from their wedding are finally out.

sports.headline: I was the missing piece of the WPL: Cheeky Dottin gives Chris Gayle vibesWPL 2025: Deandra Dottin was at her very best after she finished with figures of 4-0-34-2 and scored an unbeaten 33, helping Gujarat Giants beat UP Warriorz by six wickets on Sunday.

Champions Trophy 2025: India to play on fresh pitches in Dubai The Indian cricket team is set to play their matches of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 on two fresh pitches in Dubai specially kept aside for the tournament.

WPL 2025: Priya Mishra, Gardner guide Gujarat to 1st win of season vs UP WarriorzGujarat Giants registered their first win of the season as they beat UP Warriorz in the third match of the Women's Premier League 2025. Ashleigh Gardner was once again top scorer for Gujarat.

Rishabh Pant was hit by a shot from Hardik Pandya but recovered quickly after being attended by the team's physio.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
